reviews.review: I absolutely loved this game. It took 10 hours for me to get through, and honestly I wish it had taken much longer. The story was beautiful and very well-written, with nice details planted all throughout Columbia. I recommend taking your time to read all the posters, watch all the videos and listen to all the audio logs. I got so invested that by the end I was in tears simply because it was over. I will be playing the first two games now, bye.

Sin duda las mejores 12hrs mejor invertidas de mi vida, la música, la historia, el fondo de cada etapa, los personajes, mecánicas simples y autónomas, es de lo mejor que e visto,  Si no estas seguro de comprarlo te digo que si lo compras no te vas a sentir insatisfecho por nada, será lo mejor que habrás echo.

Normally, this is not my kind of game. Normally, I wouldn't have left a review. This isn't normally. It's quite an incredible game, with quite an incredible twist.

Overall, fantastic game. The game play was fun yet challenging and the two main characters work extremely well together. Not just their characters, but the companion AI is near flawless with how well you naturally interact with her in battle. The story is great (even if the twist had already been spoiled or me) and there were a lot of good world building subtle touches that really hit your heart. The example that comes to mind is a voice log you find of a man who caught an enemy courier expecting an adult but caught a kid. The audio was honestly gut wrenching and I had to actually stop playing for a second to process it. That being said, there was plenty of wonderful comedy with the two leads. The ending was fantastic and an interesting way to end the bioshock story.
holy shit this game is god, purchase it now.
Just finished the game and now feel empty inside...

Admittedly I was late to picking up Bioshock. Mostly because I'm not interested in horror and I'd assumed that's what it was all about. Boy I was wrong. I cannot stress enough how enthralling the story was, a beautiful piece of work. Leaves you feeling satisfied, deep in thought and craving more.
Never plaid any of the previous Bioshock games, I had heard they were awesome games, and I really enjoyed the story, game play and feel of this game. Has an awesome twist of an ending.

Bioshock Infinite = Overwhelmingly overrated. 

It's a good game, not a great one. Don't fall prey to the fanboy hype. Is it fun? Sure. But Bioshock Infinite suffers from a convoluted plot that does not make much sense and seriously repetitive combat. The setting is a departure from the earlier games in the series. Instead of being in an underwater city your character brawls through a cloud city-nation in the early years of the 20th century. It's an interesting mashup. But it became tedious after the novelty of the scenery wore off. Progression through the game's world felt limited and linear. The new gimmick is using a hook to whip around from point to point on tram rails. It did not do much for me. 

As with previous Bioshock installments you have a few powers that you can choose to equip and upgrade but it's all the standard stuff. You are limited on weapon load out which I found to be disappointing, and they did not pack much of a punch until they had been upgraded significantly. There's a steampunk element to it all which is kinda hip, but for me the game really started to shine once I completed the main story and began the Buried At Sea DLC's. Both installments brought this full circle back to the earlier games in the series and that was a nice touch.

Get this on sale including the Buried At Sea DLC package.

趁着打折推荐一款游戏，生化奇兵：无限，本体剧情和前作没有什么关联。
蒸汽朋克风格的世界观，独特美感的建筑和云端之城。
本以为是那种大叔救出象牙塔里的公主最后温暖的happy end，但越往后，收集到越多的信息，剧情开始变得深邃，当最后谜底揭开的时候，才明白这是一个关于救赎自己曾经犯下的错误的故事。那个一直想去巴黎的女孩最终没能去到巴黎，而犯下错的主角也为了结束一切死在了曾经那个令时间线改变的地方。

This is quiet possibly one of my favorite game ever.  The BioShock games has all ways held a special place in my heart and I think everybody should play them at least once, but I whole heartedly think that Infinite is the best of the series. 

Right now I'm writing this review right after beating the main story and I have to say that I haven't seen a story from a game like this in a long time and its refreshing. The plot will keep you hooked till the end and will leave you questioning what the f**k just happened. But everyone knows that even with a great story gameplay is still as important and to be honest it above average, you'll be fighting through a hoard of e cannon fodder to learn more about the story and repeat the cycle. Sometimes while playing there was some bugs during playtime but nothing game breaking more simple stuff like sometimes it would take a while for textures to load but besides that nothing that really ruined the game for me.

All in all this game is a must have 9/10

인생명작

An diesem Spiel stimmt einfach alles - wieder einmal. Schon der Vorläufer Bioshock war herausragend. Für beide gilt: keine Ansammlung von überzuckerten Features, sondern eine perfekt ausgewogene Kombination aus Ambiente (Grafik, Sound, Musik), Gameplay (Waffen, Fertigkeitsmods, Strategie, Geschicklichkeit, Steuerung) und Story Line bzw. ihrer Erzählformen. Und die Geschichte ist dabei durchgehend konsistent und glaubwürdig! Für mich als narrativ-philosophisch veranlagten Gaming Veteranen ist das besonders wichtig. 

Das Gameplay ist anspruchsvoll genug um auch versiertere Gamer nicht zu langweilen. Lediglich die Fertigkeitsmods fallen etwas dünn aus. Nur vier Slots für ein paar wenige, mehr oder weniger nützliche Fertigkeiten, [spoiler]wobei im ganzen Spielverlauf nur drei Build Varianten hilfreich sind (Hauptteil: Electro/Gunfight, Comstock Rehab Center: Electro/Melee und End Fight: Invulnurability/Melee)[/spoiler].
Aber ich will ich mich nicht beschweren, denn zuviel des Guten würde das Ambiente zerstören!

Die wahre Größe von BioShock Infinite offenbart sich allerdings nur dem, der eine Affinität zur Philosophie hat. Am Ende bekommt man einen InformationShock verabreicht, den man dank der finalen Ereignisse gar nicht sofort verarbeiten kann. Ich für meinen Teil mußte das alles erst mal ein paar Tage sacken lassen. Erst mit Erklärung der Handlung (Youtube) und erneutem Durchspielen bzw. Analysieren der verstreuten Hinweise wurden die Zusammenhänge im Detail klar. Glaubt niemandem, der behauptet, er hätte sofort alles verstanden! Das ist ohne Vorabwissen nicht möglich! Wahrscheinlicher ist, das derjenige die Tragweite der Geschichte überhaupt nicht überrissen hat.

Das bringt uns nun gleich zu den DLCs. Die Meinungen respektive Bewertungen gehen da etwas auseinander und ich selbst hatte auch zuerst nur das Hauptspiel gekauft. Das war übertriebene Vorsicht, würde ich heute meinen, denn im Rückblick auf die Haupthandlung kann ich wieder nur eines sagen: Hut ab! Ambiente, Gameplay, Geschichte, Konsistenz: trifft 100% meine Erwartungen, die erwartungsgemäß schon recht hoch waren. Und wie bisher gilt auch hier : erwarte das Unerwartete! (Ist das jetzt eigentlich ein Widerspruch?!)

Wenn man schließlich auch das zweite DLC gedanklich vararbeitet hat - was dann schon schneller geht - wird einem klar, daß man ein Theaterstück vom Allerfeinsten in Drei Akten mitspielen durfte. Virtuelle Bühne, große Kunst! Einzigartig!

一场过时但又华丽的冒险。老派硬汉和塔里逃出的公主，经典却又不经典。

本来我以为八个右键技能用不着，结果发现对于我这种一枪打不中的菜鸟是福音。

Everyone should play this game and the rest of the series if they like fps games.

Gameplay: It is a little more tight and restrictive than that of Bioshock 2. It does have cool gameplay elements with the addition of tears; which adds a whole level of variation to the combat scenarios. However it does take away the ability to hold all your weapons at once. (which is a little more realistic lol) The Vigors are cool and all have a unique ability that adds dimensions to the combat. Movement is good and is a little more fast paced than the previous games. 

Overall 3.5 / 5

Graphics: They were really good and fit the theme of Columbia. I liked them they were in between realistic and cartoonish which creates an eye pleasing combination. 

Overall 4 / 5

Characters: I found them interesting and I thought that Comstock played a more active and menacing villian like that of Andrew Ryan. Elizabeth was interesting and had quirky dialogue. Booker was haunted and had some really good lines. These characters were more flushed out and relatable than that of the first 2 protagonists in the series. 

Overall 4 / 5

Scenery/Atmosphere: I really liked the scenery in this game it was like some patriotic art deco or something, but it was great. It really had character to it; it felt like a living breathing world in the brinks of destruction. It tackled social issues that were very present in the era and it really showed how bad things could be back then. But aside from that the overall atmosphere was insane the clouds and the colors popped and the architecture was well designed. It was an excellent sequel location to Rapture. 

Overall 5 / 5

My problems with the game were mostly the gameplay. I liked the gameplay of Bioshock 2 way more. But it is definitely worth your time to check out. I would recommend you play one and 2 first though; especially if you plan on playing the DLC.

Overall Review 4 / 5

Had this game in my backlog for like three years- Really regret not getting into it sooner! 

Pros:
Guns were simple and varied. the abilities created fun gameplay moments. The story was an exciting and fun one!

Cons:
The gameplay isn't varied at all. It's a nonstop shooter-fest, but if that's your thing then it's gonna be a fun time. the story was fun, but I found the ending to be a little over convoluted and over dramatic. I felt like I'd be left with a theme on life or something (because of all the religion and philosophy involved in the game) but instead it goes for the more "mind fuck" ending. Still a 8/10 story tho.

This is a great game and a benevolent example of how you do politics right by building the games story and setting around it not last minute half ass attempt at virtue signaling for praise by the political activist gaming media.

The story so far is immersive. Politics and religion is well done and there are risque moments in the game that I fear because of our current media's obsession with identity politics would get slandered and dragged through the mud for. Unfortunate. It's event's like that that impact the immersion of the world the developer's have created in a positive way.

 One gripe I have with the game is the saving situation. It's a major design flaw. The game will automatically save at certain check points. I lost more than 15 minutes of gameplay because I hadn't reached the next checkpoint. A "Save and Exit" feature would've been great.

One of the best games I've ever played, it has left a lasting impression.

Although technically this is a more accomplished game than the earlier Bioshock games it came within  a narrow whisker of a negative review.  This is definitely going to be a narrative review and I wouldn't take a simple good/ bad as telling the story.

    The fundamental problem is now starkly revealed.  The Bioshock games set up what would be superb environments for an RPG and instead gives us a FPS.  John Carmack's claim "Plot in a computer game is like plot in a porn movie" is now outdated - but not for FPSs.  As a result Bioshock Infinite creates an amazing new world, gives you a longish half hour to take in the sights, and then becomes an on rails shooter.

   This is actually a bigger problem in Bioshock Infinite than the earlier games because your character knows a lot more than you do so the morality of the game becomes more problematic.  The opposition are generally set up to be unlikeable but not necessarily so unlikeable that your killfest is justified.

   The graphics are beautiful but combat is a step backwards.  In the reverse of ultra dark environments there are now super brightly lit areas where enemies covered by glare can be accurately shooting you.  There's nothing particularly good in the weapons, some old favourites are gone, and the replacements for Plasmids are generally weaker, more awkward to lose,  and use more power.  You now have single health and power bars and can't carry med kits and hypos.  However this is offset slightly by acquiring a Halo like rechargeable shield.  The worst change is that you can now carry a maximum of two weapons.  Through most of the game this wasn't a problem since ammo and weapon drops were plentiful but there's a longish section where both dry up and I eventually got through on the clumsy melee attacks alone.  Outside easy mode this might not have been viable.  There aren't that many different kinds of enemy and certainly the variety seemed reduced from 1 and 2.  The new McGuffin is a melee arm that allows you to grab hold of overhanging projections and ride sky rails but the biggest impact is making map traversal that more awkward.

    Loot is scattered around generously but I never found any of the more interesting stuff to which clues were dropped.

   I'm sorry but I didn't like the story.  From the outset I didn't know why I had to do what I had to do and part way through something happens that makes you think - is this still even relevant ?  It also goes the slightly irritating route of you need to get B, but before you get B you need C, but then now you need D to get C etc.  There are also hints that undermine even the little you think you know - so the entire game feels like "The Hangover".

   The game looks gorgeous.  The degree of invention is amazing.  The opening, combat less, thirty minutes show how much care was invested in the world.  But then you spend most of the next ten or so hours shooting things.  NPC interaction is as spartan as always - just so much more notably in a world where interaction is so much more feasible.

   Bioshock Infinite on sale comes in at a price now where the game should be bought and played just to experience it.  Criticisms that an early controversial scene have no later relevance were simply false - that conflict drives the parallel story unfolding around you.  It's an amazing world that the devs have created and the FPS is ... okay.  TF 2, Depth - John Carmack is right - you don't need that much story and here the dissonance between the environment and you running around killing hurts the game.

   The reality is that Bioshock's depth of creativity would work far better with a Mass Effect style RPG and Bioshock Infinite provides an amazing arena for second division sport.

   Sorry.

I played this game for a while in 2013 then I stopped and didn't ever play it again since that time... Then I heard a buddy talking about it, saying that it was great and how he loved the Bioshock series so much. Then I decided to install it again and give it a go. Then I remembered why I've stopped playing it: the game sucks, the gunplay is just horrible. Even compared to most FPS games released back in the day, it's still really bad, clumsy, slow, dull and repetitive. The plot and the storyline might be incredible, I confess I'd really like to know what happens to Booker and Elizabeth but I can't really stand the awkward gameplay.

Which is a shame because i'm really excited for the story...i just don't want to play through an entire shooter to get there. This is a game that feels like it'd be more enjoyable to watch than to actually play.

Not sure how it is without all dlc, as I bought the complete package with the season pass on sale, but how did I miss this game previously? Gripping story line! Awesome action. Absolutely superb game! Two thumbs up...if I had more hands Id give it more!

Bioshock Infinite... En mi opinión, el mejor juego de la saga y mi juego favorito por su historia tan compleja e interesante a la vez al tocar temas como la teoría de las constantes y variables entre dimensiones, vas a querer completar el juego en el menor tiempo posible para saber que es lo que pasará con la historia de los carismáticos personajes acompañado por una jugabilidad frenética y más libre a lo que vimos en anteriores entregas, mejorando por completo cada mecánica implementada... No importa que te termines el juego en su historia, aún no quedaras satisfecho y tendrás una y mil cosas por hacer y descubrir sin llegar a ser tedioso o aburrido y con momentos en donde los personajes te harán reír, enojar y tal vez hasta llorar :c... Irrational Games, gracias por esta obra de arte que desgraciadamente no es reconocida como se debe y puedo decir que ahora entiendo el por que competía por el GOTY contra un titan como lo es GtaV.

Call of Halo Shock Infinite is a horrible god awful game....at least once you've sunk in a while's worth of time, it isn't until after the fact that you finish this game that the charm and admittedly fun gameplay really starts to fade. Ken Levine is great at disguising his trash political messages with a great looking environment and pretty colors, proving that nothing has to be really deep or meaningful but instead look nice in order for humans to buy it. On the surface, it looks like a great game and the gameplay is enjoyable but wayyyyy too easy, and no I'm not a 600lb gaming legend with a 240Hz gaming monitor. The gameplay is fun but it's a complete ripoff of Halo in every way shape and form, they even admit it through the introduction of rechargeable shields and even allow you to carry only two weapons for some odd reason. 

THE CRAP STORY
Now onto the worst part about this game that even Elizabeth herself admits when she yells "IT'S JUST LIKE LES MISERABLES," which by the way is the worst possible thing to do for your story. That is pointing out the "original" story you're trying to tell is basically the same as another, the game knows it's just a ripoff and I swear I get a Dr. Who vibe from the Luteces who are apparently omnipotent with their reality bending capabilities but cannot just end the game by teleporting DeWitt to the end of the journey with Elizabeth in hand. Which leads to the next worst part of this game's broken nonsensical story which are it's plot holes, and trust me, there are a metric ton of them. Ken really tried to make this game appear cool and super deep but really it's a giant goop of nonsense that to the average idiot like yourself will seem ZMOG!!!!11!!1! SUPER DUPER DEEP!!111! You could make the argument that the Luteces were doing this as a giant experiment all along but if they're basically omnipotent and can travel through time, then wouldn't they know the answers to everything before it all happens? The ending is a complete mind flub as well, it makes ZERO sense as in it is a complete breakdown of any logic. Most will likely have to play the ending again to fully understand what happened, but I'll sum it up here, Booker is Comstock in a different timeline, Elizabeth is his daughter and given to the Luteces to create another omnipotent trans-dimensional traveler like themselves. Just one problem, instead of meeting Comstock at the point of which he was created, Booker fills in his role when they jump to the time Comstock was created, so the only way to kill Comstock is to then kill Booker so that he never becomes Comstock, which makes absolutely no sense when they could've just jumped into the timeline that would've killed him without killing Booker. Not only that, this whole story ends up being completely pointless because of the burial at sea DLC where Comstock apparently was never destroyed despite the events of the main game(so great, none of your efforts even mattered, what a story Ken). I really want to like this game because it is very visually appealing, but Ken needs to get a job as an interior decorator instead of making these nonsensical games.

It has some major bugs, that may or may not affect your gameplay. However, I do tent to came back for more, even if the ending is a little bit of a letdown, it gives me some sense meaning somehow, when I play it, even after several playthroughs. I say, give it a chance, it wont leave your head alone for a while.

great story. great characters. great setting. great guns?? 9.2/10

IN SHORT:
I find the story to be very good. It may feel a little bit clichee at first but you will quickly see that it has so much more.

The gameplay is good, thanks to the hook you get in the game. The hook allows you to have some good vertically in the fight. But sadly the Gameplay hasn't this open world like in the 2012 Gameplay Reveal.

In terms of the Graphics, the game is from 2013 so it isn't the biggest looker but thanks to the Style it still holds up pretty good in comparison with other 2013 games. Still no Cryisis 3 tho.

Recommend? I think that if you are looking for a good Story game with interesting Gameplay mechanics like: Superpowers.

Особенно если проходить все части ). Самая лучшая игра в своём жанре. Жаль что не вечна. Если будет стоять выбор между этой или какой-то другой игрой берите её . Жизненно)
Best game I've ever played!  Hands down, no comparison.

很好的游戏，气氛方面，华丽下隐藏着压抑，剧情方面能让人反复琢磨，非常精彩，唯独就是这个枪支子弹限制的有点严重，打的不爽。
值得一提的是这个游戏人物塑造的非常好，虽然画面卡通，但是通过细节和互动，会让你感觉女主角是个活生生的人，而不是你的npc队友，妙不可言。

스토리도 괜찮고 재미도 있고 잘 만들긴 했는데 이젠 그냥 레일슈터가 되버려서 파밍하는 맛은 별로 없습니다. 전작과의 연관성도 별로 없고 신선하긴한데 이젠 바이오쇼크라기 보다는 그냥 다른 fps라고 보는게 더 나은거 같습니다. 후속작 바다의 무덤은 바이오쇼크스럽긴 합니다.
그래도 전작의 명성에 뒤지지 않게 잘 만든 게임입니다. 추천.

Такс,игра пройдена и итог таков.Мой мозг немного не понял кто такой Комстрок. Было понятно почему Элизабет потеряла палец.Я теперь знаю как отхреначить машину имея только крюк.Я умею делать огонёк.И также я должна оценить своего тиммейта.Так как она не умирала +5 очков,она давала хилки и соль(не ту о которой вы сейчас подумали)+2 очка,давала патроны+2 очка,и делала мне разрывы в жопе потому что я бегала по всей локации+1 очков,И того 10 из 10.
